surveyDescription: Standardized Information Gathering (SIG) Lite questionnaire for cybersecurity assessment

questions.questionText: Is there a formalized risk governance plan approved by management that defines the Enterprise Risk Management program requirements?
questions.helpText: The risk governance plan should outline the organizational structure, roles, responsibilities, and processes for managing enterprise-wide risks.
options: Yes, there is a formalized risk governance plan approved by management that defines the Enterprise Risk Management program requirements
No, there is not a formalized risk governance plan approved by management that defines the Enterprise Risk Management program requirements
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: No, there is not a formalized risk governance plan approved by management that defines the Enterprise Risk Management program requirements

questions.questionText: Is there a corporate security policy that is approved by management, communicated to constituents, and has an owner to maintain and review?
questions.helpText: The security policy should be a high-level document that sets the direction for security within the organization.
options: Yes, there is a corporate security policy approved by management, communicated to constituents with an assigned owner
No, there is no corporate security policy
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: Yes, there is a corporate security policy approved by management, communicated to constituents with an assigned owner

questions.questionText: Does the security policy address information security roles and responsibilities?
options: Yes, security policy addresses information security roles and responsibilities
No, security policy does not address information security roles and responsibilities
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: Yes, security policy addresses information security roles and responsibilities

questions.questionText: Is there a policy that defines access control requirements that is approved by management, communicated to constituents and has an owner to maintain and review?
questions.helpText: Access control policies should define who can access what resources under what circumstances.
options: Yes, there is an access control policy that meets all requirements
No, there is no access control policy
Partial implementation
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: Yes, there is an access control policy that meets all requirements
givenAnswer.comments: Policy includes MFA requirements and role-based access controls

questions.questionText: Are user access rights reviewed at least annually?
questions.helpText: Regular access reviews help ensure that users only have the permissions they need.
options: Yes, user access rights are reviewed at least annually
No, user access rights are not reviewed regularly
Reviews are conducted but not annually
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: Yes, user access rights are reviewed at least annually
givenAnswer.comments: Quarterly reviews conducted by department managers

questions.questionText: Is there a policy that defines network security requirements that is approved by management, communicated to constituents and has an owner to maintain and review?
options: Yes, there is a network security policy that meets all requirements
No, there is no network security policy
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: Yes, there is a network security policy that meets all requirements

questions.questionText: Are networks segmented to separate different security zones?
questions.helpText: Network segmentation helps contain security breaches and limit lateral movement.
options: Yes, networks are properly segmented into security zones
No, there is no network segmentation
Partial segmentation implemented
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: Yes, networks are properly segmented into security zones
givenAnswer.comments: DMZ, internal, and management networks are separated with firewalls

questions.questionText: Is intrusion detection/prevention system (IDS/IPS) deployed on the network?
options: Yes, IDS/IPS is deployed and actively monitored
Yes, IDS/IPS is deployed but not actively monitored
No, there is no IDS/IPS
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: Yes, IDS/IPS is deployed and actively monitored
givenAnswer.comments: Using Cisco Firepower with 24/7 SOC monitoring
